roll (somebody) over.translation[0].defi: to turn your body over once so that you are lying in a different position, or to turn someoneâ€™s body over
Ben rolled over and kissed her.
The guards rolled him over onto his front.
roll (somebody) over.translation[1].defi: if you roll over a loan or investment, you obtain a new loan or investment to replace one that has MATURED (=reached the end of its life)
Certificates of deposit are automatically rolled over at current interest rates for another period of the same duration unless the bank is given other instructions.
